column4: how do i mount a floppy disk so i can save stuff to my a: drive?
i'll pretend i know what you said soundray. off i go.
There is a package called mtools that give you a variety of DOS-like commands to use to work with floppy disks without mounting them, assuming they are FAT formatted (most are).
You can use commands like mdir, mcopy, mdel, etc, all "DOS" commands prefaced with the letter m, hence the "mtools".
